docs.title: 1. Introduction to Chronos Ledger
docs.text: Chronos Ledger is an all-in-one SaaS platform designed for time tracking, automated invoicing, and crypto payments. This solution is tailored for freelancers, startups, and enterprises, providing tools to automate time entries and invoice generation while integrating with crypto payment systems like Request Network.

docs.title: Automated Time Tracking:
docs.text:
Chronos Ledger automates time tracking across multiple projects, enabling users to log hours either automatically through predefined schedules or manually as needed. Users can adjust logged hours manually for accuracy.

Include a screenshot or diagram of the time tracking dashboard here. Description: Dashboard that visualizes weekly time logs, total hours per project, and the option to manually edit time entries.

docs.title: Automated Invoicing and Payment Processing:
docs.text:
Invoices are generated based on logged time or project milestones, and sent automatically in either fiat or crypto using the Request Network. Users can customize invoices and track payment statuses.

Include a visual template for an invoice here. Description: An invoice template displaying project details, total hours worked, payment methods (crypto/fiat), and due dates.

docs.title: Crypto-Based Payments:
docs.text:
Chronos Ledger integrates with Request Network to support crypto payments, allowing businesses to send and receive payments securely and track transaction statuses via blockchain.

Add a diagram illustrating the crypto payment flow here. Description: Diagram showing how Chronos Ledger integrates with Request Network to send/receive crypto payments, along with real-time payment tracking.

docs.title: Advanced Reporting and Analytics:
docs.text:
Generate detailed reports on time logs, project costs, and performance. Reports can be customized based on client, project, or time period.

Placeholder for a reporting dashboard screenshot here. Description: Dashboard showing customizable filters for reports, graphs, and tables detailing project hours, costs, and invoiced amounts.

docs.title: AI-Assisted Project Estimation:
docs.text: AI-powered project estimation tools help generate accurate timelines and cost predictions based on project scope and historical data.

docs.title: Document Uploads for Projects:
docs.text:
Users can upload related documents (e.g., contracts, deliverables) for each project, allowing for easy access to important files.

Add an icon or diagram illustrating document uploads per project here. Description: Icon showing the ability to upload and manage files within each project dashboard.

docs.title: Overview of Free and Paid Plans:
docs.text: Chronos Ledger offers two tiers: - Freemium: Suitable for freelancers managing basic time tracking and invoicing for up to 2 projects. - Premium: Designed for startups and enterprises, providing advanced tools like automated invoicing, crypto payments, and unlimited projects.

docs.title: Detailed Feature Comparison:
docs.text: Feature Freemium Premium Time Tracking 1 active project Unlimited projects and team members Invoicing 1 automatic invoice/month Unlimited, automated based on logged hours Crypto Payments Limited Full integration with Request Network Reporting Basic weekly reports Advanced reports with filters and customization Document Uploads 1 document per project Unlimited uploads Client Management Up to 2 clients Unlimited clients Support Standard Premium support with priority access

docs.title: System Overview:
docs.text:
Chronos Ledger is built using Next.js (frontend) and Node.js (backend), with PostgreSQL for data storage and Request Network for handling crypto payments.

Include a system architecture diagram here. Description: Visual showing the interaction between the frontend (Next.js), backend (Node.js), and third-party services like Request Network for crypto payments and PostgreSQL for data storage.

docs.title: Security and Compliance:
docs.text: Data is protected through SSL encryption, role-based access control (RBAC), and AML/KYC compliance for crypto payments, ensuring secure and private transactions.

docs.title: CEO/Owner Access:
docs.text: Full system access to manage financials, projects, and reporting tools.

docs.title: CFO/Finance Access:
docs.text: Access to financial operations such as payroll, expenses, and invoices.

docs.title: Employee Access:
docs.text: Limited access to time tracking and assigned projects.

docs.title: Custom Roles:
docs.text: Coming Soon: Ability to create custom roles with specific access levels.

docs.title: 6. Automated Time Tracking
docs.text:
Chronos Ledger allows users to configure automated time tracking through predefined work hours for projects. A cron job handles the automation of time logging, ensuring that hours are captured based on the user’s input.

Include a flowchart of the cron job logic for automated time tracking here. Description: Flowchart showing how the cron job runs daily to log hours for ongoing projects automatically.

docs.title: 7. Automated Invoicing and Payments
docs.text: Invoices are automatically generated based on the time logged per project. Users can customize invoices and choose to send them in either crypto or fiat, with the ability to track invoice statuses and notifications when payments are made.

docs.title: 8. Expense and Payroll Management
docs.text: Manage employee payroll with options for crypto payments. Employees can submit expenses for approval, and payroll is processed based on the hours logged, with crypto-to-fiat conversion available for payroll if required.

docs.title: 9. Reporting and Analytics
docs.text: Chronos Ledger provides detailed reports based on time tracking, project performance, and invoicing data. Reports are customizable, allowing users to generate insights based on specific client needs, time frames, or project metrics.

docs.text:
• How do I unlock my Early Adopter NFT?

docs.title: Introduction to Chronos Ledger
docs.text:
Welcome to Chronos Ledger, the all-in-one SaaS platform designed for time tracking, automated invoicing, and crypto payments. Chronos Ledger is tailored for freelancers, startups, and enterprises, offering tools to automate time entries, invoicing, and integrating with crypto payment systems like Request Network.

Chronos Ledger’s key functionalities include: - Automated Time Tracking: Easily log and track time for multiple projects. - Automated Invoicing: Automatically generate invoices based on logged time or project milestones. - Crypto Payments Integration: Securely send and receive payments in both fiat and cryptocurrency. - Advanced Reporting and Analytics: Generate customized reports on time logs, costs, and project performance. - AI-Assisted Project Estimation: Use machine learning to forecast project timelines and budgets.

Explore this documentation to learn more about how Chronos Ledger can streamline your workflows and simplify your financial management.

docs.title: AI-Assisted Project Estimation
docs.text: Chronos Ledger leverages AI-powered tools to assist users in generating more accurate project timelines and budget forecasts. The AI system analyzes historical project data, time logs, and resource allocation to make intelligent predictions that help businesses plan projects efficiently.

docs.title: Key Features:
docs.text:
1. Automated Timeline Estimation:
  2. AI algorithms analyze past project data and provide estimated timelines for new projects based on similar project scopes and team sizes.

  3. The system automatically adjusts predictions based on ongoing progress, resources, and any updates to project scope or deliverables.

  4. Budget Forecasting:

  5. Predict the total cost of a project by analyzing historical data on expenses, time logged, and payment structures.

  6. The AI system takes into account current market trends, resource availability, and hourly rates to offer accurate budget forecasts.

  7. Historical Data Analysis:

  8. Chronos Ledger’s AI engine analyzes previous projects to learn from actual completion times, resource allocation, and budgets.

  9. It uses this data to continuously improve its prediction models, ensuring that estimates become more accurate over time.

  10. Scenario Simulation:

  11. Users can simulate different project scenarios by adjusting factors like team size, resource allocation, or project complexity. The AI will recalculate timelines and budgets based on these inputs, giving users a what-if analysis for better decision-making.

  12. Dynamic Adjustments:

  13. As projects progress, the AI makes dynamic adjustments to the timeline and budget predictions. If delays occur or additional resources are added, the system will automatically recalibrate its estimates.

  14. This allows project managers to stay on top of potential risks and adjust strategies in real time.

  15. Integrated with Time Tracking:

  16. AI-assisted estimations are fully integrated with Chronos Ledger’s time tracking and invoicing modules, providing a holistic view of project performance, time spent, and associated costs.
  17. When time is logged on a project, the system continuously learns and updates its estimation models.

docs.title: How it Works:
docs.text:
• When creating a new project, users input key details such as project scope, team size, and deadlines. The AI system will analyze historical data and similar projects to suggest an estimated timeline and budget.
  • Users can refine these estimates by adjusting resources, adding team members, or changing project parameters. The AI will recalculate the estimations in real time.
  • As the project progresses, the AI provides ongoing updates, adjusting forecasts as new data is logged through time tracking and expense management.

docs.title: Use Case:
docs.text:
A software development company is bidding for a large client project. By using Chronos Ledger’s AI-Assisted Project Estimation, they can quickly generate an accurate project timeline and budget forecast based on previous similar projects. The company adjusts the estimate by adding more developers, and the AI system recalculates the timeline, allowing them to present a detailed, realistic proposal to the client.

Add a visual flowchart showing the AI-assisted estimation process here.

docs.title: Crypto Payments Integration
docs.text: Chronos Ledger integrates seamlessly with Request Network to offer secure, transparent, and efficient crypto payments. This functionality allows businesses to both send and receive payments in cryptocurrency, providing flexibility for international clients and those operating within the blockchain ecosystem.

docs.title: Key Features:
docs.text:
1. Support for Multiple Cryptocurrencies:
  2. Chronos Ledger supports payments in popular cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), USDC, and other supported coins by Request Network.

  3. Users can choose their preferred cryptocurrency during invoice creation, providing flexibility for clients.

  4. Secure Payment Processing:

  5. All cryptocurrency transactions are secured through blockchain technology, ensuring payments are transparent, immutable, and traceable.

  6. Payments are processed through Request Network, which leverages decentralized payment processing to ensure that both the sender and receiver have a secure payment experience.

  7. Real-Time Payment Tracking:

  8. Payments made via cryptocurrency are tracked in real-time, allowing users to see when payments are sent, received, or confirmed on the blockchain.

  9. Notifications are sent when a payment has been successfully completed, and users can monitor the status of all transactions directly from the Invoicing Dashboard.

  10. Simplified Crypto Accounting:

  11. Chronos Ledger offers tools to convert cryptocurrency payments into fiat currency equivalents, making it easier for businesses to manage their accounting and reporting.

  12. Transaction history is logged with both crypto and fiat values for simplified tax reporting and compliance purposes.

  13. Low Transaction Fees:

  14. Cryptocurrencies often come with lower transaction fees compared to traditional payment methods like bank transfers or credit card payments, especially for international transactions.

  15. Multi-Currency Wallet Support:

  16. Users can add multiple crypto wallets to their Chronos Ledger account, allowing them to receive payments in different cryptocurrencies, based on the preferences of their clients.

docs.title: How it Works:
docs.text:
• When an invoice is generated, the user can select cryptocurrency as the preferred payment method. This automatically generates a payment request through Request Network.
  • Once the client makes a crypto payment, it is recorded on the blockchain, and the invoice is updated with the payment status in real-time.
  • Users receive notifications when payments are confirmed, and the payment is reflected in the Invoice History.

docs.title: Use Case:
docs.text:
A web developer with international clients uses Chronos Ledger to receive payments in Bitcoin for completed projects. The client is invoiced in BTC, and once the payment is received on the blockchain, the invoice is automatically marked as paid. The developer can see the transaction details and real-time payment status in Chronos Ledger’s dashboard.

Add a diagram illustrating the crypto payment flow here.

docs.title: Document Uploads for Projects
docs.text: Chronos Ledger allows users to manage project-related documentation by uploading and storing important files directly within each project. This feature helps users keep all relevant documents, such as contracts, deliverables, and project plans, organized and easily accessible.

docs.title: Key Features:
docs.text:
1. File Uploads for Each Project:
  2. Users can upload multiple documents for each project, including contracts, specifications, and other related files.

  3. All uploaded files are stored securely within the project dashboard, making it easy to access and manage project documentation in one place.

  4. Supported File Types:

  5. Chronos Ledger supports a variety of common file types, such as PDF, Word documents, Excel spreadsheets, images, and more.

  6. Users can view, download, or delete files directly from the project dashboard.

  7. Version Control:

  8. Chronos Ledger offers basic version control for uploaded documents. Users can upload updated versions of the same file, and the system will maintain a version history.

  9. This helps teams keep track of changes made to important documents over the course of the project.

  10. Document Permissions:

  11. Access to uploaded documents can be restricted based on user roles. For example, only the project owner or admin may have access to sensitive contracts, while team members can access project specifications and deliverables.

  12. This ensures that only authorized users have access to important files, protecting sensitive information.

  13. Integration with Time Tracking and Invoicing:

  14. Uploaded documents can be linked to specific time logs or invoices, providing a complete audit trail for deliverables tied to specific project milestones or time entries.

  15. Users can easily reference contracts or agreements when generating invoices or reports.

  16. Cloud Storage Integration (Coming Soon):

  17. Chronos Ledger will soon offer integration with popular cloud storage services like Google Drive, Dropbox, and OneDrive, allowing users to synchronize documents across platforms.
  18. This feature will further streamline document management and ensure all project files are securely backed up.

docs.title: How it Works:
docs.text:
• Users can upload documents directly from the Project Dashboard by selecting the relevant project and navigating to the Documents section.
  • Documents are organized by project and can be searched, downloaded, or deleted as needed.
  • Version history allows users to see previous versions of uploaded files, providing a complete record of document updates.

docs.title: Use Case:
docs.text:
A project manager working on a website redesign project can upload all relevant contracts, design assets, and project plans into Chronos Ledger. These files are stored securely within the project dashboard and can be easily accessed by team members or referenced when generating invoices for specific project milestones.

Include a screenshot or diagram illustrating the Document Uploads feature here.

docs.title: Automated Invoicing & Payments
docs.text: Chronos Ledger provides a seamless automated invoicing and payment processing system, allowing users to generate and send invoices based on tracked time or project milestones. Whether you're invoicing in fiat or cryptocurrency, Chronos Ledger ensures that your invoicing process is automated, accurate, and secure.

docs.title: Key Features:
docs.text:
1. Automatic Invoice Generation:
  2. Invoices are automatically generated based on the hours logged in the Time Tracking system or based on predefined project milestones.
  3. Users can define invoice templates, set due dates, and customize line items for each client.

  4. The system supports invoicing in both fiat and cryptocurrency, with full tracking of payment status.

  5. Payment Integration:

  6. Chronos Ledger integrates with the Request Network to securely process cryptocurrency payments.
  7. Invoices can be paid in Bitcoin, Ethereum, or other supported cryptocurrencies, offering flexibility to clients and ensuring fast, secure payments.

  8. The system also supports traditional fiat payments, allowing for hybrid invoicing.

  9. Invoice Customization:

  10. Users can customize their invoices with branding elements, including company logos, custom colors, and additional details such as tax information.

  11. Invoices can be configured to include or exclude specific time logs, milestones, or expenses.

  12. Real-Time Payment Tracking:

  13. Payment statuses are tracked in real-time, whether the payment is made in crypto or fiat.

  14. Notifications are sent when payments are received, and users can easily track unpaid, partially paid, or completed invoices.

  15. Recurring Invoices:

  16. Set up recurring invoices for long-term projects or retainer clients. These invoices are automatically generated and sent on a predefined schedule (e.g., monthly or quarterly).
  17. Manage recurring billing cycles with minimal effort, ensuring steady cash flow for ongoing projects.

docs.title: How it Works:
docs.text:
• Automated Workflow: After time is logged or a milestone is reached, Chronos Ledger will generate an invoice automatically. The invoice can be reviewed and sent directly to the client via email or a secure link.
  • Payment Integration: Invoices can include both crypto and fiat payment options. Once a payment is made, it is reflected in the invoice tracking system, and the user receives a notification.

docs.title: Use Case:
docs.text:
A consultant working on a large project can set up automatic invoices that are triggered upon reaching specific project milestones. For example, once 50% of the project is complete, an invoice is generated and sent to the client. Payments can be made in either crypto or fiat, and the consultant is notified once payment is received.

Include a visual template for an Invoice here.

docs.title: Advanced Reporting & Analytics
docs.text: Chronos Ledger offers powerful Advanced Reporting & Analytics features, enabling businesses to generate detailed insights into project performance, time tracking, invoicing, and payment data. These customizable reports help users track productivity, manage finances, and make data-driven decisions.

docs.title: Key Features:
docs.text:
1. Customizable Reports:
  2. Users can generate reports based on specific parameters such as client, project, time period, or employee.

  3. Customize the layout and content of reports to focus on the most relevant data, whether it’s hours worked, project expenses, or invoiced amounts.

  4. Visual Dashboards:

  5. Chronos Ledger provides visual dashboards that offer an intuitive overview of key metrics. Users can view data such as:
    • Total hours logged per project
    • Invoiced vs. paid amounts
    • Unpaid and overdue invoices
    • Employee productivity and performance

  6. Data is presented in charts, graphs, and tables, allowing for easy interpretation and decision-making.

  7. Real-Time Data:

  8. All data is updated in real-time, meaning that reports are always accurate and reflect the latest time entries, invoices, and payment statuses.

  9. Users can monitor the progress of projects in real time and see how financial metrics evolve over time.

  10. Exporting Reports:

  11. Reports can be exported in multiple formats, including PDF, CSV, and Excel, making it easy to share with clients, stakeholders, or accountants.

  12. Choose to export summaries or detailed breakdowns depending on the audience’s needs.

  13. Scheduled Reports:

  14. Set up automated, scheduled reports that are generated and sent out at regular intervals (e.g., weekly or monthly).

  15. Useful for providing clients or internal stakeholders with regular updates without needing manual intervention.

  16. Expense & Budget Tracking:

  17. Chronos Ledger’s reporting tools also support tracking project budgets and expenses, allowing users to monitor costs in real-time and ensure they remain within budget.
  18. Compare project costs to estimates and see whether you’re on track or if adjustments need to be made.

docs.title: How it Works:
docs.text:
• Users can access the Reporting Dashboard from the main menu, where they can select the type of report they wish to generate (e.g., time tracking report, invoicing report, or expense report).
  • The system pulls data from the time tracking, invoicing, and payment modules to create a comprehensive overview.
  • Reports can be customized with filters such as project, client, or time period, and users can view reports directly in the dashboard or export them in the desired format.

docs.title: Use Case:
docs.text:
A project manager overseeing multiple ongoing projects can generate a weekly report that highlights the total hours logged, invoiced amounts, and expenses incurred for each project. This allows the project manager to compare progress against project budgets and timelines, ensuring that all deliverables are on track and clients are invoiced correctly.

docs.title: Automated Time Tracking
docs.text: Chronos Ledger simplifies time management by providing an automated time tracking system. This feature allows users to log their working hours across multiple projects either automatically or manually, ensuring accurate timekeeping for invoicing and reporting purposes.

docs.title: Key Features:
docs.text:
1. Automatic Time Logging:
  2. Time tracking is automatically triggered based on predefined work schedules or project rules.
  3. Users can set specific work hours for each project, and the system logs time accordingly.

  4. Time entries can be manually adjusted if necessary to ensure accuracy.

  5. Manual Time Adjustments:

  6. Users have the flexibility to adjust or override automatically logged hours to ensure the time data reflects their actual work.

  7. Time entries can be edited directly from the Time Tracking Dashboard.

  8. Dashboard Overview:

  9. The time tracking dashboard provides a visual overview of hours logged per project on a daily, weekly, or monthly basis.
  10. Users can easily view their total hours worked, along with the ability to make quick adjustments to logged time.

docs.title: How it Works:
docs.text:
• Cron Job for Automation: Chronos Ledger uses a cron job that automatically logs time for each project based on the configured work schedules. This removes the need for manual input, making time tracking effortless.
  • Manual Entry Option: In cases where automatic logging is not feasible, users can log time manually. Both options provide a comprehensive record of hours worked.

docs.title: Use Case:
docs.text:
Imagine you're a freelancer working on two different projects simultaneously. With Automated Time Tracking, you can set specific time blocks for each project, and the system will log your hours automatically. If you need to make manual adjustments (e.g., you worked late or took an extended break), you can easily do so through the dashboard.
